r_text: Very nice people. They were very helpful. The breakfast was very good. If you get in your room and close the door you don't hear any noise from the the other rooms.it is Very closed to restaurants and bars.

Do not stay at this hotel unless you like loud music, noisy traffic, motorcycles screeching throughout the night, bad coffee, twin beds that are hard as a board, room that smells like sewer gas, and overflowing toilets. This is the worst hotel stay I’ve ever experienced and I travel a lot. I don’t get it. I can’t even find a reason to give it half of a stat.

Don't waste money. Very rude receptionist . If you want to experience go head and try , People who don't want hassle it. Take different hotel. This place is like a prison they trying to ruin your mood. Check out 15 June 2019 12:00 pm.

Many things to report about this hotel. Unfortunately most of them are bad: Upon late night arrival "greeted" by an inhospitable receptionist. All male staff seemed to have the same obnoxious non-helpful attitude. The room smelled of moist - hence no ventilation. The aircon heating didn't really work (cold rainy days in Cyprus in February this year). The walls are thin - lots of noise from other rooms and the hall way - especially from the teenage camp installed on the same floor. The in-room breakfast order form didn't work - four of them in the room, but apparently the hotel doesn't use them anymore. The breakfast was mediocre and repetitive - they turned off the heat under the "hot" food half an hour before closure leaving luke warm food for the last guests. The wifi is super…

We stayed five nights in early October 2018. It's Located close to city Centre. It's only 20 min walk to reach the center of Lefkosia . Nice room. Very good breakfast. It worths staying when you visit Lefkosia, Cyprus.

We had a booking there as part of a conference, suggested by the organiser. Our twin room was sooooo.... dirty. The carpets had remainings of literally EVERYTHING. The towels were old and rusty. Absolutely discusting...

I spent two days in Europa Plaza Hotel Nicosia for a business trip. The room is clean and tidy. The view from my room was horrible, it views to an allay with a gas stain and a container yard. the breakfast was fine. It is pretty far from a city center.

Room was not ready probably due to high season took a suite it was good decor but basic amnesties that you will find in a normal room. room service was good. had a Jacuzzi that doesn't work. location is good if you are targeting Nicosia.

Booked in here for 4 nights. Room very basic, no tea or coffee facilities in room, no bottled water provided.Interrupted sleep from racing motor bikes which started up each evening around midnight. Room very warm and no air conditioning this time of year “ It is winter, madam! Was the only explanation we were given.“ My room was unbearably hot as it got the sun from first thing in the morning and for most of the day. Could not leave the window open at night because of the traffic noise. On our third night there the hotel was invaded by a group of 55 teenage school children from Greece and their teachers. They spent most of the evening running up and down the corridors and stairs, banging doors, shouting and laughing. They even knocked on my bedroom door and ran away laughing and screaming. After complaining they were quiet for a short period and then it all started up again. This carried on on and off till 2am.The next morning after once again complaining to the receptionist we were told, “ Well you are checking out this morning,” . Unfortunately as far as we were concerned we knew we had one more night booked as we were told we were booked there for 4 nights. The receptionist then informed us they were fully booked that night and had no free rooms. We had to then pack our bags quickly before leaving and went off to complete our business whilst other arrangements were made. We were then informed that the hotel admitted they had made a mistake in the booking and offered us an upgrade to a suite room in a separate part of the hotel away from the school party. Here we had an excellent nights sleep in a suite that had tea and coffee making facilities, plenty of bottled water and very comfortable surroundings and more importantly was quiet and we got a good nights sleep once the motor bike race had competed for the night.The food in the evenings we ate in was very good and Janis looked after us extremely well. Breakfast was a bit of a disappointment as the cooked food, despite being set over heaters, was cold, including the scrambled eggs! The toasters took an age to toast the bread and needed to be put in the moment you entered the dining room so that it was ready by the time you had had some cereal, fruit, yoghurt etc.For business it was fine apart from the teenage school children, although if you are distracted by traffic noise this might not suit you. Especially when you feel you have to be ‘on the ball’ for business the following day.

Very cleanFree internetRoom is basic with small TV and only free channelsheating is a bit noisyBreakfast is basic to poor, very “tourist low cost oriented” with supposed some choices but was bot happy with the quality

This has been my favourite hotel since a few years but this time it was a disaster. The hotel is as good as it always is, clean, tidy, service at reception and by the manager most professional, breakfast very generous but a) side reading bed lights are both on, so if one wants to sleep do what I did, unscrew the bulb. Asked reception to fix it but nothing happened, both reading lights are on b) a leaflet in the room welcomes you and offers 20% discount on any food etc. However when we had a snack and drink at the Plaza cafe, they said to our great suprise that this is not valid !!! c) worst of all, on Fridays and Saturdays though this is an inhabited area just before midnight several huge motorcycles apparently without any silencers challenge each other at highest possible speeds and the noise is beyond any description. You feel as if 50 tanks are speeding around the hotel. Called reception at 02.00 hours he said there is nothing to be done. Called police at 03.20 (after midnight) he said a patrol car would be in the area. Half an hour later the same situation the tank battle with disturbing sounds that one could hear miles away continued all through the night till morning . It is surprising that others have commented on this yet the police obviously couldn't care less. On Saturday night we bought some ear plugs, but this was a terrific night worse than the previous one. Just horrible .. Lastly, when we arrived there were no bath towels in the room...The hotel is not responsible for the racing noise but they have the obligation to demand action by the police. As it is today, it is impossible to sleep and I am not exaggerating.

Rather basic in terms of the room, clean although the bed is rock hard and there was no bottled water in the room. No coffee or tea provided. The double glazing does not mask the noise of the main road enough.The bathroom whilst clean needs a modern refurb.Lift in the hotel is slow and 'cosy'. Desk staff were helpful enough and there is a pub/bar next door which served OK American style food in the evening although with music and football if you fancy.Doubt I would stay again.

I'm very dissapointed with the reception service. I asked for a room on the back side, and receptionist said I have no luck, there was no free one. I asked him just because the street is so noisy in the night caused by street car and motorcycle racing. Receptionist told me that it is rarely, and to keep the windows closed. It was noisy again and too hot in the room, and rarely - every night. Rooms are too small, and average clean. Under our window were big garbage containers, so very bad smell came to our room. We booked a tripple room and got 2 beds and roll away bed. On my complain, receptionist answered that they don't have tripple room. Only wiht extra child bed. But on the invoice, surprising but expected, they have. They charged me full price for roll away bed as for normal one!!!!First evening I asked the receptionist to call a cab for us 5, and I told him which company to call. First he didn't understand that we needed the cab at 7 p.m. He ordered for next day at 7 a.m. Then he refused to call Taxi cab (the best one) telling me that they have theirs. After 20-25 min cab came but normal car for 4 people. We all managed to sqeezed in a car. One problem solved. Than came the other one. The driver doesn't speeks english, only russian. The third problem was that he didn't knew which way to drive to asked address. I gave him my cell phone with google map, We were very happy when we reached our destination.Breakfast is pretty good, but the coffee was awful. From the self-service coffee machine leaked hot light brown watter. I asked a waitress to fill a machine with coffee. Nobody from staff took care about any guests needs. There was no goodmorning, or even goodbye when we were leaving the hotel on our last day.

The hotel is surrounded by night clubs and bars - loud music -The busy street by the hotel you hear loud motorcycles driving by.Bed mattress is extremely hard,No coffee in the room, no water - worst property I stayed in Cyprus.

My company booked for me a room because I had a business dinner in Nicosia. It was a very basic room. I did not like the bathroom because of the shower: it got flooded after taking a short shower...!Breakfast was nice.There is no gym or swimming pool.

Only spent one night there as limited by time. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was superb and far more choices than I had expected by it being called 'continental'; breads, cereals, fruit, sausages, eggs, beans, bacon, cheeses, cold meats etc etc. Would highly recommend it to anyone :)

In Nicosia on business, this hotel was a convenient base for resting after long days of meetings and visits. Most services and facilities were adequate. The room was large and spacious with good air conditioning. Bathroom was slightly cramped but clean and serviceable. Bed was large and furniture, although dated, was functional. Location is bland and uninteresting - not the fault of the hotel. Left early each morning for work so I am unable to comment on the breakfast. Did eat at night in the restaurant/bar which was a tad institutional with dominating TV screen. Food was standard but fish - if you choose carefully. Service was good and to the point, if somewhat brusque and detached. No complaints, but one could find better.

Maids left room spotless each day. No real shower cubicle but only a small bath. Water pressure and temperature regulation was excellent. Minibar empty. Noisy road. Breakfast selection very good, bread stale however. Bed comfy enough for a good nights sleep. Location so so, quite a stretch from city centre but excellent for business trips say to European University

Located in the core of the movida in Nicosia, rooms are easy but comfortable, free WiFi, bed is good. Breakfast so so.Just closed to it, there are lot of nice pic and bar. In 30 minutes by feet you can reach the old history center.To be suggesting...

Visited on a June weekend.The staff doesn't have a universal professional approach,some of them even are unhelpful or unkind.The rooms are decent,with old furniture,clean,mediocre air conditioning and unevenly large bed.Some basic amenities must be sought after.The breakfast was average and the pricetag wasn't hefty.Situated near a highway,in my opinion,this hotel is best for a professional trip

Friendly staff good location although not at the center. Decent but old furniture, certainly a renovation is needed, decent breakfast. If no luxury is sought is an acceptable hotel for business purposes. Wifi, a little slow but works quite well. Acceptable value for money

Stayed here for 2 nights in June 2017 as part of a wedding party. Large clean room. AC worked fine. Good enough bathroom (though not allowed to flush used toilet paper - how the hell does one dispose of them otherwise?). Good breakfast. Only 7 Euro by taxi to the centre. No frills basic hotel. Appropriately priced. Friendly staff. I have no complaints.

If you like cars, traffic, dirt and noise at night, This hotel will be your hotel staking in Nicosia. This is for the rooms in front of the hotel. Of you like gasstation, boys playing with there scooters and making noise this hotel is also yours. Ask for a room on the backside.

Situated relatively far from "center" and big but uncomfortable bed. Good breakfast and courteous staff but no hairdryer and not available when requested. Unable to take bath as bath plug not present. Also unavailable when requested and not until next morning. Reliable wifi.

Having read other reviews I asked for a room away from the main road side. Was told noise not a problem if I kept the windows closed. It was a problem - people racing high performance cars and plenty of motorbikes from 11pm till past 1am. Room lacked tea/coffee making/ plugs in basin/bath.Beds hard. Room was surrounded by groups going in and out of each others rooms continuously.. Plus points were good quality and value food , and other than original receptionist helpful staff

Europa hotel is a nice hotel, quite new in the hall and restaurant part, but regolar rooms are a bit old and they could renovate them a bit. The bathroom was clean, but the bathtub had an old curtain that didn't seem very clean. Beside that the staff is nice and helpful.

In hte rather bleak landscape of downtown hotels in Nicosia, the EUROPA stands out as a mid range beacon. Its pluses are the excellent service and very accommodating courteous staff & owner, clean rooms, a sumptuous breakfast and reliabel wifi in all areas, all for a decent price. The flip side is a hotel with a defintie air of decadence that the lobby and restaurant makeover cannot hide. Rooms & their bathrooms defintiely need a facelift and makeover and above all good sound proofing that seems to be non-existent in all room floors. The beds are marginally uncomfortable, with hard matresses and a/c has no middle ground, it is either FREEZE or SWELTER. The location of thehotel, off center, is far from ideal as there is little to do or se if oyu walk out the door and have no car, the real center being a good 1/2 hour brisk walk away and back. Hence, one night, tired we decided to try the hotel restaurant: the menu is impressive, the ambiance on the outside terrace a nice but the food was tastless. At least it was not expensive...

Hi, we only stayed one night but we joined others who were staying for a week.We were on the fourth floor. The elivators were small but there were two.The breakfast was adiquate with a good choice of food.

Hi, I have just spent 2 nigths in Europa Plaza Hotel and did not really enjoyed. The bed was like a rock! Not good at all to rest. Room clean, but could be better! Sanitary kit available every day. Air condition.Very noisy in the night. Could not fall asleep for 2 hours.....!!! Breakfast-OK.Perhaps ok for 1 night, but if you must spend 1 week for work, is better to take another hotel.In average is better than my experience in Le Havre, France ;)

Perhaps it was because I'd had a long flight delay and arrived at the Europa at 3.30 a.m., but I was immediately unimpressed by this hotel. At least the night receptionist was awake when I arrived, but the hotel had a deserted feel about it. I was offered a beverage but told that all the cold drinks were 'locked up' and that there was a mini-bar but it would be empty. The receptionist made me a cup of coffee, but even this was tepid by the time I had been unable to find my room due to lack of signage and then been unable to unlock it. The room had two single beds pushed together, which is always a bad sign, and boasted cheap wooden furniture, carpets that needed cleaning, and a TV so small that you needed binoculars to watch it. Breakfast was good for those needing a large helping of bacon and scrambled eggs, but meager in terms of a cold plate. On the plus side, the free wi-fi worked well and the world looked a better place when I discovered Murphy's Irish Bar right next door. I know that the Cypriot economy is in poor shape, but a hotel could at least provide a bottle of water in the room. Given that prices are reasonable in Nicosia, there are better options.

Once again this proved to be our favourite choice in Nicosia and we were given a great room facing north on the 3rd floor. . Since our last visit it has been renovated and refurbished making it even a better choice, with a new air conditioning system which however was rather noisy and tiring. Apart from this, service was impeccable (apart from a bucket and mop in the corridor for a whole day). Room service menu was a pleasant shock, and breakfast was above average, plentiful and inviting.(though closing early, by 10.00 o clock).. Free Wi-fi needs some improvement. Still one of the best small hotels in Nicosia with a personal touch. (please, do not translate in greek, it s always a disaster and meaningless)

The Europa is a smart and overall well appointed hotel, with friendly and helpful staff, but one or two things surprised me. There were no coffee / tea facilities in the rooms - which I was surprised at given the quality of the rest of the hotel - also no bath plug - these things not peculiar to my room, apparently others in my party had the same experience. As I was staying only one night I did not, I have to say , raise the issue - but I thought it ' a little strange.

Expensive island, ok hotel. Restaurant and meeting rooms part are nice. Rooms are oldish, smell cigarette, they are clean rooms and towels are new but refrigerators are empty in the room. No regular or hot water, tea, coffee in the room.Breakfast is really nice, and staff are helpful.

The only thing that we did not like was the Holy Bible in our room that was not the original one, but from a heresy. Our stay was nice and the room very clean! The bed was of a king size and we really emjoyed our sleep!

We stayed in Nicosia as we were going to watch football.The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was an adequate size for the 2 of us and it was very clean and had all the facilities we needed, including air con, which was well needed. There was also free WiFi.Although our room did overlook the main road and there was some noise from the traffic, it did not really impact upon us.The hotel is about a 5 min taxi ride to the main shopping area. However, there are a few bars within a very short distance from the hotel (including an Irish Bar, right next door).All in all the hotel met our needs for an overnight stay in Nicosia,

Excellent hotel, first time we visited, reached all our expectation, great location, very clean, staff ready to help, very good service, bery good breakfast, good price. I would visit again with my family.

We had stayed at the hotel for our first year wedding anniversary and have stayed at one of the hotels suites. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The service was great and the atmosphere superp. The breakfast at the hotel is served very well and it is nice and tasty. The location of the hotel is great.

I am currently in hotel whilst find permanent accommodation in Cyprus, cannot fault the staff in particular Bianca who is always ready to help, same goes for Rene, clean, comfortable and cost effective definite worth visit

Have been using this hotel for more than 6 years three to four times each year. The staff are very friendly, polite and helpful. The hotel is well managed and very clean. I understand the hotel will be undergoing a facelift which should help. My visits are mainly for business which helps considering its location.

My second trip to Nicosia and both time I stayed at tis hotel,things haven't changed I great hotel and great staff.This time I spent 10 days here while awaiting for my apartment,the staff in particular Bianca who always had a smile and nothing was to much trouble.The breakfast was always good and the buffet was always hot and fresh,I only had a few meals but still great food and service.The Cuban guy ( sorry no name) in the bar was also very good and very helpful.I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel and will stay again next tine I come to Nicosia later in the year.

This is a business hotel rather than a place to vacation.During our stay it was suffering from noise from external repair work but the hotel did try to keep disturbance to a minimum.The foyer and bar areas are pleasant and cool. The outdoor area will be lovely when the repairs are finished - although it should be noted they are 10m from a busy road.The staff are very pleasant and helpful.The rooms are good - very large bed in ours. However, rooms to the back of the hotel suffer a little from traffic noise - mainly the incredibly noisy motor bikes favoured in Cyprus.Breakfast is varied and plentiful - anything is available from bacon and eggs through continental. The chef will happily make omelettes.The dinner menu is varied, reasonably priced and the food is of good quality.10 minsutes on the local bus to the old city bus station.

Beautiful Hotel, nice area close to City centre , spacious rooms , nice breakfast ,very clean and friendly staff! Was there for a seminar last week. Nice plus to this hotel the free wifi and free parkin area.

It's amazing that there doesn't seem to be a decent hotel in the whole of Nicosia. The Europa Hotel was looking good on the web but it is only just adequate and has one big problem: you will be kept awake by the informal motorcycle GP racing that starts in the street outside at around midnight and goes on until about 3 AM. This isn't just the annoying buzzy little mopeds that blight every Mediterranean town, these are street racing monsters with loud exhausts that blast down the street at 160 km/h, at ten-minute intervals timed to re-awake you every time you drift off to sleep.So ask for a room at the back of the hotel and use earplugs. The rest of the hotel is OK for the money; clean, well managed by pleasant efficient staff but gloomy and old-fashioned with small bathrooms. You'll survive a couple of nights and won't feel overcharged.

This is a small, yet practical hotel, for a short stay in downtown NIcosia. The best future of the hotel is its Personnel, extremely polite, courteous, more on the 5 star side rather than the 3 star that it is. I called from AThens asking for a hairdresser, they immediately gave me the phone number and explained it is located across the hotel.made my life easy.,when on location, I asked for an iron, they immediately gave it to me.As for breakfast, it was excellent, the coffee rich and the orange juice freshly squized...not like other 5 star ( such as Coral beach in Pafos for which I wrote another critic), the choice of coffee was reasonable, with 4 different kinds being offered. Cleanliness was impeccable although the rooms need some refurbishing and probably the bathrooms, some renovation. Still, the hotel is not expensive at all for what it offers and it's location is the second best of its futures, the first being its kind and polite PErsonnel.

If you are looking for luxury this is not the place for you. We visited Nicosia on business for a couple of days & this hotel was just perfect. Nice location near everything, clean rooms and very helpful staff. The beds are a little too hard, but then again, good for your back. Comfortable & air conditioned is a plus. You even get a complimentary breakfast buffet with a lot of variety food.You definitely get more than you pay. Great value!

This a fairly small and quite hotel. Reception staff where very helpfull, kind and serviceminded.Rooms are nice and good value for money. Outside temperature was over 40C but the aircondition handled it fine.Breakfast was good. Bed was bit to hard for my taste.

I order this hotel room when i was visiting Nicosia, hotel is very clean and good look after.Stuff was helpful .Rooms are very clean and tidy...I enjoy rooms for affordable price it was worth it believe me its classy and clean.Food is very good ..They have complimentary fruit basket ( fresh fruits) .

Comparing to other hotels in Nicosia Europa hotel is almost 2 times cheaper than the other hotels. It is not a posh hotel but for its value it was excellent. It was very clean and and the staff was very helpful.

Asked for a quiet room on arrival, was given one at the noisy front. I asked to change and was given one directly above the kitchen. Not that front or back makes much difference, the midnight to 4am noisy motorbikes that only seem to run a top revs will keep you awake no matter which room you are in. I then had to plead with the hotel to turn on the air-con. For some bizarre reason, aircon can be requested 2 weeks in advance, and then it will be switched on. Just when I was getting used to hot and noisy rooms, the hotel came up trumps by having a coach load of teenagers rampage up and down the corridors, banging on my door, to be told when complaining "That's what teenagers do". Had to move hotel at my expense for that night.Staff are friendly enough until you make a minor request or complain, with the only solution "I'll let the manager know on Monday"Fire exit doors jam on opening on most floors (I have temporarily adjusted as many as I passed through), and furniture stacked in emergency exits (I thought this was illegal in the EU?) - I wouldn't want to be in this hotel if there was an emergency.Plus points: good complimentary breakfast, good wifi, good evening meals if you stay in, good kebab shop just down the road

Great location a few kms from the city centre and the Museum, pleasant, tidy , exceptionally clean and well designed spacious room with small flat screen tv. Great personal service and a rich tasty breakfast nicely presented. Restaurant and bar prices at very attractive prices far less than expected. Best of all, the willingness of the manager and staff to meet our every desire especially when the wi-fi was out of operation for two days.On the negative side, though the temperature was in the 20s there was no cool airconditioning therefore the room temp was unpleasant so you have to keep the windows open, yet the street noise on a 24 hour basis is beyond description. Evenmore it seems that this area is ever so popular with teens and their huge noisy Triumphs all thru the night for competitive noisy racing leaving you no chance to get any sleep. This is not the responsibility of the hotel but they should demand the police to do something on this issue.

when you book a business hotel in the center of a small capital you wait to be in a good position which it does, to be clean which it is , to have good staff which it does , to have spacious rooms with all you need whoich it does especially the executive room which cost only 8 euros more and you can use kettle for coffee tea etc , big desk , extra huge bedroom ,nice and clean bathroom. to have good breakfast which it has for 3 star i thing very good. so for a 3 star hotel with 50 euros i think u get more than you expect. thats why i rate it 5 stars not because its four seasons!

Stayed at Europa Hotel for 5 nights together with a group of about ten colleagues to attend a conference. The hotel is very clean, the staff is extra helpful, offers a varied choice for breakfast, the food at breakfast and in the restaurant was delicious. My room, on the first floor, was quite spacious and well decorated. It also had a good wifi connection. Good value for money!

It was the second time that we stayed in this hotel in Nikosia. Although it is a clean and fair hotel, it is not the best value for money choice. No wifi, pure breakfast, traffic noise during the night. Although most visitors are not Cypriots, rooms still have socket outlets of flat 3 pin-type. A power cord adapter is supplied by reception under request... but, it is just one, and nowadays, one is not enough.

A nice little hotel in the centre of Nicosia that won't break your budget. All standard facilities are there, but no luxury. One of the few hotels of the city with such ample parking space around. Another plus: numerous eateries within walking distance.

I spent only one night in this hotel after the recommendation of my colleague and I really appreciated the nice and convenient feeling that was exposed. The price was indeed very interesting as it was a value for money spending if you consider the facilities. Breakfast was sufficient. Location depends on the activities you have in mind!

The hotel's location makes it very convenient for a business trip in the area with nicosia's embassies and business centers. One which is further from the city center and reachable by taxi or by feet (a twenty minutes walk). So depending on the purpose of the visit you might hate it or find it very convenient. The rooms are decent and offer a basic comfort - not impressively good nor unbearably bad. Very clean and polite cleaning service. The staff is always willing to help. The breakfast offer is average, but you can have a plentiful breakfast. The restaurant also offers good dishes at decent prices. It is a hotel i don't have anything against, but which also didn't positively surprised me. A minus might be the poor control of room temperature, as the nights were quite cold and couldn't heat properly the room. Overall, an ok hotel.

I travel to this hotel for business purposes.the rooms are clean, the breakfast satisfactory and the personnel is polite. It is situated in a quite part of the city, not far from the center, but you will need a taxi to go there.Overall, it offers very good value for the money.

This hotel is always clean and the staff are great always wanting to help.The rooms when you arrive are always like a sauna, The AC is off to save power but the rooms are sealed and get lots of Sun,Food is ok at this hotel, And there a number of bars and eating places just next to the hotel.This is a great place for a night or two if on Business, Not a holiday hotel

I stayed at this hotel because I was on a business in Nikosia and my office was at 5 minutes walk from the hotel. I was disappointed with the quality of beds and linen - could hardly fall asleep. The promised wi-fi actually is available only in lobby or qt the first floor, if you are higher, there's no signal. The room was clean and there was not any noise from the street.\The breakfast was quite acceptable.Nearby there's a good bar called Mamasita. do not miss it. A nice Costa Coffee place is to the left from the hotel and takes you about 2-3 min to go there.

My husband and I stayed here while he is doing business nearby. We stayed in a executive room which was quite nice, good bedding, and good servicing by the cleaning staff. Once I let the attendants know I like extra coffee and sugar, they were sure to supply me extra every day. The front desk staff are extremely friendly and accommodating, making sure my husband got his laundry expedited when he was starting to run out of clean clothes. You definately need a car if planning to see the city, but hotel parking is free and abundant, plus it is not far from the city center. We found our stay delightful and will definately be back again.

I had to stay in Nicosia for business as this is not a holiday/ weekend break destination. I picked the hotel as it was the nearest to a funciton I had to attend.The hotel itself, I believe is a 3 star and for a 3 star it is ok. Basic amenities, old fashioned rooms, basic breakfast etc.What I wasn't comfortable with was the cleanliness of the room which I was not 100% sure of. There were some vague stain on the sheets and the overall feeling of the room was that it was not spotless. The piece de resistance, was a hole on the floor which was neatly covered by the carpet. Unfortunately this was discovered by my wife who was in high heels at the time- she was not happy about it! Another issue for me was that the minibar was locked and I only discovered this in the early morning hours when I woke up and needed some water.As I said, the hotel, for a 3 star is OK. However the price (special offer at EUR100 for one night), I thought was ridiculous, especially as I had recently paid slightly more to stay at a 5 star beach resort in Cyprus. Furthermore the receptionist insisted that I should prepay the whole amount instead of paying upon my departure which I thought was strange.My low rating has more to do with its price rather than the actual hotel.
I liked staying in Europa hotel - nice rooms, good servise, great breakfast. It seemed a little to far from the center, where the life is. But good for a business trip - very quiet to sleep there.
beds are very hard, you need to get the key of the minibar and pay 50 euro , a bit strange, only one elevator, payed 110 euro per night, this is it absolutely not wordth

I stayed in this hotel for a week with work as part of a large group.The rooms can have 3 beds which makes it cost effective, each room has a tv, table and chairs and bathroom with bath and shower and a supply of shampoo/ bath gel.We were next to the main road - all rooms have a road- to be honest at night the main road was probably quieter than the boy racers by the back of the hotel.Breakfast was lush a nice spread of cold and hot options.There is a bar downstairs where drinks are arounf 6/7 euros.Next to the hotel is a Iriosh bar- prices are mostly similar maybe cheaper for beers. It got busier as the night wore on and also serve a selection of food.There is a petrol station and a late opening convience store which sells food snacks and drinks.Town is a walk away and we found ourselves a nice Taverna were prices were alot cheaper and the locals were so friendly.There is a mini bus service to Larnaca airport also.PS if you love cats- beware i nearly brought one home.Staff were friendly and we had no issues :-)Free WIFI too

I stayed in the Europa for two nights while on a work trip. I found the hotel comfortable ( the beds certainly weren't too hard, they perfect for me) and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. It is a short taxi ride (about 6 Euros) to the old city. I thought the hotel was good value and would certainly stay there again.

Short stay at this hotel mainly because it was close to work. I have never experienced such discomfort, the beds are the hardest I have ever experienced. At night there is also a constant noise from motorbikes, which is disturbing. On the positive side staff are friendly and helpful and breakfast was more than adequate.

I spent a week at the Europa whilst on business in Nicosia. The rooms are like any other 3 star, souless and dull. The aircon pumped out hot air so my room was stifling for the majority of the time, depsite having borrowed a fan from reception to cool things down. The food is good but your choices of a location to eat are not so appealing - the charmless bar or your souless room. To get to anything interesting you need to drive or take a cab. I felt that the rooms were reasonably clean until I found a dirty pair of knickers by the side of my bed from a previous occupant. I was glad to get out of the place by the end.

once i decided I wanted to find a good hotel in Nicosia, with everything I needed, without being ripped off during my frequent trips to Cyprus.Well ... here it is. I am sure there is no better business hotel in Nicosia (for those who really work and have no time for swimming pools). New, king size beds, minibar, friendly staff, free internet, decent restaurant, free parking, good location - TV channels list is not the best but hey .... you can't have it all !

The Europa is a quiet, clean and friendly hotel about 15 - 20 minutes walk from the centre of Nicosia. Some of the booking websites, etc list as it as central, which it is not. The benefit of this is a quiet location. Our room was a good size and fairly well equipped. Minor points are that you have to ask for a key to the mini-bar, or for a hair-dryer and the customer use pc in the foyer has to be paid for, which is not good in a hotel of this price. There don't seem to be any non-smoking rooms and the general areas are all smoking.

Stay in this hotel for 5 days in AugustVery frienfly staff on Reception, clean hotel, fresh towels, Near the hotel is free parking space. Breakfasts are tasty but there were no choice of Juice-only orange.In the room there are extra pillows, bathroom is niceWe book the room by e-mail,paid 90 EUR per night for a room.I think fr Nicosia it is good value for money

A beautiful experience! Nice clean and large rooms, they change everyday the towels. Morning buffet breakfast with many choices.The central lobby and the people were friendly. It is conveniently located and ample parking. Although reaching by car is quite tricky. Overall this is a nice boutique hotel for business travelers as well as tourists. I did my reservation thru Cyprus Airways. Very good value.

Not much I can say really, a nice clean, modern hotel aimed mainly at business traveller (free wi-fi in lobby) but would serve tourists just as wellLocated in the financial area of Nicosia so a distance from the old town, but easy to get to/from the motorway even in rush hourThere was an 'Irish' pub next door that served food and seemed to be plenty of other similar bars / restaurants in easy walking distance. Neighbourhood seemed safe and well lit.Free car parking outside the hotel, rooms were decent size and clean, reception areas bright and airyNo complaints would stay again as is an equal standard but cheaper than Holiday Inn etcMy collegue was upgraded to the Africa Suite just because he had stayed there the previous week as well which was a nice touch!

Stayed at the Europa for 7 nights on business. This is a pleasant newly decorated hotel. The rooms are a fair size, and have wireless internet access. They are decorated in a modern style and rather nicely done. The hotel is along a busy road, but is well insulated so no road noise is audible in the rooms. The Europa is not right in the centre, but Nicosia is not big so it is easy to get there. Breakfast was a buffet, and was quite nice.The only downsside I could see was that there is no gym, and non ion the immediate neighbourhood unless you are a woman (one woman only gym).All in all I would recommend this one.
